Modules¶

class Main.MainWindow¶

QMainWindow of this application

goToEcSim(checked=None)¶

Set EC Simulator as the central widget

Parameters:

checked – if the button was checked

Set home screen as the central widget

Parameters:

checked – if the button was checked

Sets an EC Optimizer as the central widget

Parameters:

  • idx – index of the selected optimisation method

  • checked – if the button was checked

Sets the central widget to the Overview screen

Parameters:

checked – if the button was checked

popupHelp()¶

Show help window

popupSettings()¶

Show settings window

setCommunityFile(communityFile)¶

Sets the currently selected community json file. Changes the title of the window to contain the file name.

Parameters:

communityFile – path to the community json file to set

severConnection()¶

Disconnects the currentGraphConn if it exists

Sets the enabled state of the side bar buttons

Parameters:

val – True or False

toggledBtn(idx, checked)¶

Emit a signal when an optimisation button has been toggled

Parameters:

  • idx – index of the button toggled (equal to the index of the optimisation method)

  • checked – if the button is checked

class Home.CommunitySelector(firstSelection)¶

Parameters:

firstSelection – whether this is the first selection after opening the app, disabling the return to the HomeMenu

Creates a list with the paths to the json files in the json path folder in the settings

Updates the list of community files. Used when the setting is changed while in this screen.

Creates or edits a file (if necessary) with the information on which amounts of days have been simulated using the current json file

Parameters:

  • name – name of the community currently in use

class Settings.Settings¶

Dialog to change the application Settings and manager of other settings set outside of this window Settings changed in this window: - JSON folder path - Output folder path - Solar data CSV file path

cancel()¶

Closes the window without saving the new settings

static findInFile(label)¶

Finds the value of a setting in the settings file

Parameters:

label – label (‘foo=’) that identifies the wanted setting

getDays()¶
Returns:

last setting of the number of days to simulate option

static getJsonPath()¶
Returns:

the path to the folder containg the json files

static getOutputPath()¶
Returns:

the path to the output folder

static getOutputPaths(community_name, days, optim_method=0)¶
Parameters:

  • community_name – name of the community json file is in use (without .json extension)

  • days – number of simulated days

  • optim_method – optimisation method in use

Returns:

tuple of the paths used to run a simulation with the set optimisation method [0] path of the consumption profiles generated by ANTGen (at 1 Hz) [1] path of the resampled consumption profiles (at 1/60Hz) [2] path of the consumption profiles after the 1st step of the optimization [3] path of the consumption profiles after the 2nd step of the optimization

static getPVData()¶
Returns:

the path to the solar data CSV file

static getSkipCg()¶
Returns:

last setting of the Skip Consumption Generator option

getlocalPV()¶
Returns:

last setting of the Use Local Lolar Data option

loadConfig()¶

Read saved settings and load them to be shown in the window

static optimizationNames()¶
Returns:

tuple containing the names of the available optimisation methods

save()¶

Saves the selected settings and closes the window

sizeHint()¶

Override of parent method

class ResultScreen.Overview(communityFile)¶

Widget to show every result of the given community. Every simulation will be in a tab identified by the number of simulated days.

Parameters:

communityFile – path to the json file of the community in use

Creates a ResultScreen using the community file stored in the object and the number of days simulated

Parameters:

days – number of days in the simulation the ResultScreen being created pertains to

initTabs(idx)¶

Creates the tabs os the ResultScreen in the given index

Parameters:

idx – index of the ResultScreen

setTabByDay(day)¶

Selects the tab which refferences the given days

Parameters:

day – the number of days in the simulation to open the tab of

showEvent(event)¶

Override of the parent method to open the tab corresponding to the last day used upon showing the widget

warnNotSimulated()¶

Shows a message box warning no community’s been selected

Tab widget containing two tabs with results from the simulation

Parameters:

  • delayCreation – whether to create tabs on init (used so it doesn’t load graphs unnecessarily)

Creates the tabs of this widget. DefaultGraphs and GraphCreator

Override of parent method

class ClickableGraph.ClickableGraph(parent=None, width=5, height=4, dpi=100, placeholderText=None, left=0.125, right=0.9, top=0.9, bottom=0.11)¶

FigureCanvas widget capable of being clicked to show the graph in a popup window

Parameters:

  • parent – parent widget

  • width – width of the figure

  • height – height of the figure

  • dpi – dpi of the figure

  • placeholderText – text to be displayed in the canvas before determining the final figure

  • left – size of the left margin

  • right – size of the right margin

  • top – size of the top margin

  • bottom – size of the bottom margin

test method to change between two graphs

paths – dictionary of relevant paths

paths – dictionary of relevant paths

class GraphParamSelector.ParamList¶

Scroll Area to contain all the created parameters

Parameters:

  • folderName – name of the folder containing the CSV file

  • name – name of the CSV file

  • houseName – name of the house containing the CSV file

  • path – path to the CSV file

  • var – columns of interest of the CSV file

  • idx – index of the parameter in the LineList

  • negative – if the values of the parameter are to be subtracted when creating the line

Returns:

list of all the ParamWidgets

hasChanged()¶

the index of the next parameter to add to the list/ the list’s length

Parameters:

idx – index of the parameter on the LineList

class GraphParamSelector.ParamWidget(name, folder, house, path, column, idx, negative=False)¶

Widget to represent a parameter that defines a line

Parameters:

  • name – name of the CSV

  • folder – name of folder containing the CSV

  • house – name of the house containing the CSV

  • path – path to the CSV

  • column – column of interest in the CSV

  • negative – if the values of the CSV are to be subtracted on the final line

changeSign()¶

Switches between + and - as to indicate if the values from this parameter are to be added or subtracted

index()¶
Returns:

the index of the parameter in the LineList

setSign(idx=None)¶

Sets the operation sign of the parameter

Parameters:

idx – index of the parameter in the LineList

  • name – name of the file

  • house – house where the file is from (‘Community’ if oustide a house folder)

  • path – path to the CSV file

  • var – column of the CSV file to use

  • text – lower text

Parameters:

code – code to tell which stage simulation is at

Signals the simulation should be cancelled, shows text confirming it will cancel as soon as possible

setText(text)¶

Sets the text

Parameters:

text – text to be shown

setTitle(title)¶

Sets the title

Parameters:

title – text to be shown

class ProcsimRun.ProcsimRun(skipCg=False, optimMethod=0, localPV='', days=5, path_steps_seconds='output/test/second', path_steps_minutes='output/test/minute', path_steps_after_first='output/test/afteroptimization', path_steps_after_second='output/test/aftersecoptimization', community_file='data.json', simulate=False, optimize=False)¶

Class to run PROCSIM

Parameters:

  • skipCg – whether to skip the Consumption Generator step

  • optimMethod – optimisation method to use (index from Settings.optimizationNames)

  • localPV – path to the CSV containing solar data (leave empty to use API)

  • days – number of days to simulate

  • path_steps_seconds – path of the consumption profiles generated by ANTGen (at 1 Hz)

  • path_steps_minutes – path of the resampled consumption profiles (at 1/60Hz)

  • path_steps_after_first – path of the consumption profiles after the 1st step of the optimization

  • path_steps_after_second – path of the consumption profiles after the 2nd step of the optimization

  • community_file – JSON file containing the community configuration

  • simulate – whether to run the simulate function

  • optimize – wheter to run the optimize function

cgExecute(cg, days, config_files_path, just_a_day=False, database_files=False)¶

Consumption Generator execute function without showing any graphs and added checks for cancellation

Parameters:

cg – Consumption Generator object in use

days: number of the days to generate data (profiles) config_files_path: path/folder where there are the house configuration files (.conf) just_a_day: if true, only 1 day is considered, otherwise all the days are considered database_files: if true, converts the database files, otherwise convertes the community files (false should be used)

cmExecute(cm, cg)¶

Chooses how to execute the Community Manager based on the optimisation method in use

Parameters:

cm – Community Manager object in use

createTimeslotsFiles(tims, folder)¶

Creates the timeslots file from a formatted dictionary

Parameters:

  • tims – dictionary in format {“appliance_name”: [[start, end, day], …], …}

  • folder – folder containing the house folders into which the timeslots files will be created

createTimeslotsFilesOpt(tims, noHouses, secondOptim=False)¶

Creates the timeslots file from the data gathered in the optimisation

Parameters:

  • tims – placed_timeslots_array from the CommunityManager

  • noHouses – number of houses in the community

  • secondOptim – if these are the timeslots of a second optimisation

createTimeslotsFilesSim(tims, noHouses)¶

Creates the timeslots file from the data gathered in the simulation

Parameters:

  • tims – timeslots dictionary from the ConsumptionGenerator

  • noHouses – number of houses in the community

getCommunityManager(optim_method, cg, path_steps_minutes, path_steps_after_first, path_steps_after_second)¶

Get the Community Manager based on the optimisation method in use

Parameters:

  • optim_method – optimisation method

  • cg – Consumption Generator object in use

  • path_steps_minutes – path of the resampled consumption profiles (at 1/60Hz)

  • path_steps_after_first – path of the consumption profiles after the 1st step of the optimization

  • path_steps_after_second – path of the consumption profiles after the 2nd step of the optimization

Returns:

appropriate Community Manager

getPV()¶

Gets solar data from CSV or Smile based on specified local data path

Returns:

appropriate solar data

getWind()¶

Gets wind data from Tomorrow (to be improved if more wind data sources are added)

Returns:

appropriate wind data

optimize()¶

Optimises the community’s consumption. Uses PROCSIM’s Community Manager module (and subclasses).

run(tryexcept=True)¶

Run PROCSIM. If no option is specified does a full run

simulate()¶

Simulates the community’s consumption. Using PROCSIM’s Consumption Generator, Renewable Energy Generator and Community Generator modules.

class Util.Util¶
static daysString(days)¶
Parameters:

days – number of simulated days in string format

Returns:

The number of days with the string ‘day’ or ‘days’ (according to the number) in front

static fileName(path)¶
Parameters:

path – path to the desired file

Returns:

name of a file from a given path with no extension

static infoFile(name)¶
Parameters:

name – name or path to the desired file

Returns:

path to the .info file of the community

static loggedDays(name)¶
Parameters:

name – name or path to the desired file

Returns:

list of the number of days (in string format) used in the file’s simulations

Note on optimisation methods¶

  • By accessing Settings.Settings.optimizationNames() most of the application’s needs are met

  • Buttons labels and other elements are dynamically created by reading the above tuple and using the names and indeces inside

  • To add PROCSIM’s functionality to these elements ProcsimRun.ProcsimRun.cmExecute() must be updated to contain the procedure related to the correspondent method

PROCSIM Running/Results Frontend
